title: The death of cash? On the contrary, it's growing faster than ever
text:
Contactless is accepted everywhere. We have payment apps on our phones that work perfectly. If you make a bank transfer the money will land within the hour, and systems such as PayPal allow us to settle any account in an instant.

With so much new financial technology around, we often assume that cash is on the way out. The banks have even started closing ATMs because no one is using them anymore.

But hold on. Here is something odd. In fact, that isn’t what is happening at all. Right across the developed world, there are more bank notes in circulation than ever before.
